data.title: Re: Roland Harold Blenkhorn's m/2 Isabell Amelia (Fairhead_ ) Appleby
data.text:
From: "David Winter davidwinter@... [nscumber]" <nscumber@yahoogroups.com>

To: nscumber <nscumber@yahoogroups.com>

Sent: Saturday, February 21, 2015 10:19 AM

Subject: [nscumber] Roland Harold Blenkhorn's m/2 Isabell Amelia (Fairhead) Appleby

Blenkhorn researchers;

Roland's m/2 was Isabell Amelia Fairhead from Mlltown, Charlotte County,

N.B. She was m/1 Frank Stanley Appleby.

Dave

BLENKHORN, Isabell Amelia (FAIRHEAD)[APPLEBY]; ; Saint John NB; Telegraph

Journal; 2008-8-12; jdlmwc

---------------

<http://www.brenansfh.com/obitsearch?first=&last=blenkhorn&home=0&dod=>

Isabell Amelia Blenkhorn

Blenkhorn (Appleby), Isabell Amelia Š The death of Isabell Amelia Blenkhorn

of Saint John, NB, wife of the late Frank Appleby and Roland Blenkhorn,

occurred on Monday, August 11, 2008 at the Saint John Regional Hospital.

Born in St. Stephen, NB on September 9, 1918, she was the daughter of the

late Raymond and Sarah (Anderson) Fairhead.

Survived by her daughter, Sally (Bruce) Slemin of Saint John, NB;

step-daughter, Peggy (Kent) Tingley; two grandchildren, Rebekah Jane and

Emily Jane Slemin; three step-grandchildren, Brad, Jill and Suzanne Tingley;

two sisters, Dorothy and Marguerite Fairhead of St. Stephen.

Arrangements are under the care of Brenan¹s Select Community Funeral Home,

Saint John, NB (506) 634-7424 with visiting starting on Wednesday, August

13, 2008 at 1 pm until service time at 2:30 pm from Brenan¹s Chapel.

Interment in Fernhill Cemetery. Remembrances may be made to the Heart and

Stroke Foundation or charity of the donor¹s choice.

www.brenansfh.com

============================================

<http://www.brenansfh.com/obituaries/4106>

Roland Harold Blenkhorn

The death of well known Saint John businessman, Mr. Roland H. Blenkhorn,

husband of Mrs. Isabell (Fairhead) (Appleby) Blenkhorn, of Millidgeville,

Saint John, NB, occurred at his residence on Monday, January 19, 2004. Born

in Amherst, NS, he was the son of the late Roland and Margaret (Hamilton)

Blenkhorn.

Roland was a devoted and active member of Main St. Baptist Church and former

member of Central Baptist and Victoria St. Baptist Churches. He was both a

Gideon Bible Representative and Chairman of the Baptist Foundation for many

years. Roland proudly served his country during WWII with the Royal Canadian

Signal Corps and later owned and operated Maritime Electronics. Roland

derived great satisfaction from fishing and gardening, though His greatest

joy in life was his grandchildren and step-grandchildren.

Besides his parents, Roland was predeceased by his first wife Vivian G.

(Fullerton) Blenkhorn, three sisters and one brother.

He is survived by his wife Isabell, daughter, Margaret (Peggy) (Mrs. Kent

Tingley), Upper Cape, NB, step-daughter, Sally (Mrs. Bruce Slemin), Saint

John, NB and sister Lyda Rafuse, FL, and several nieces and nephews. Grandad

will be fondly remembered by his grandchildren: Mark Bradford Tingley, NC,

Jill Margaret Tingley (Chris Dobbin), Halifax, NS, Suzanne Patricia Tingley,

Vancouver, BC, and his step-grandchildren: Rebekah Jane Slemin and Emily

Jane Slemin both of Saint John, NB, whom he loved so dearly.

Resting at Brenan's Select Community Funeral Home, 111 Paradise Row, Saint

John, NB, (506-634-7424). Visitation on Wednesday from 7-9 p.m. and Thursday

from 2-4 and 7-9 p.m. Funeral service will be held from Main St. Baptist

Church on Friday, January 23, 2004 at 2:00 p.m. Remembrances may be made to

the Canadian Cancer Society, Gideon Bible Society or to a charity of the

donors' choice. A Royal Canadian Legion Tribute to a Veteran Service will be

celebrated at Brenan's on Wednesday at 7:00 p.m.

www.brenansfh.com

===================
